required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Liposomal Bupivacaine in Adductor Canal Blocks (ACB)
clinical_study.official_title: Does the Addition of Liposomal Bupivacaine to the Adductor Canal Block Impact Narcotic Use After Primary Total Knee Arthroplasty: a Prospective, Blind Randomized Control Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate whether liposomal bupivacaine is superior to normal bupivacaine in terms of providing better pain control postoperatively after total knee arthroplasty.

study_design_info.masking_description: Participants and study team members involved in data collection and data processing will be blinded to the intervention.

primary_outcome.description: Opioid use after SoC TKA surgery will be evaluated as morphine milligram equivalents

secondary_outcome.description: Average daily distance ambulated using the 6 minute walk test
Number of days of hospitalization after elective admission for TKA surgery
Incidence of post-operative nausea and vomiting (PONV) will be reported throughout the duration of hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants requiring narcotic prescriptions
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants that require further narcotic prescriptions will be reported

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of urinary retention from narcotic use
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of urinary retention from narcotic use will be measured via the need for urethral catheterization.
Post-Operative Pain will be measured via a self-reported Visual Analog Scale (VAS) score. The VAS Pain score ranges from 1-10 with 1 being free of pain and 10 being the most pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Satisfaction as per the Knee Society Score
secondary_outcome.description: The Knee society score has a total score ranging from 100-0. Scores between 100 and 85 points are considered excellent results, scores between 84 and 70 points are considered good results. Scores between 69 and 60 points are considered fair, and scores less than 60 are considered poor results

arm_group.description: Participants undergoing elective Total Knee Arthoplasty (TKA) surgery that are randomized to the control group will undergo an ultrasound-guided Adductor Canal Block (ACB) with standard of care (SoC) Ropivacaine post TKA surgery.
Participants undergoing elective TKA surgery that are randomized to the intervention group will undergo an ultrasound-guided ACB with Liposomal Bupivacaine post TKA surgery.

intervention.description: 266 mg or 20 ml Liposomal Bupivacaine injectable solution
0.5% (5mg/mL) 20 mL single dose SOC anesthetic Ropivacaine.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. The subject is scheduled for elective unilateral primary TKA
2. The subject is â‰¥ 18 years
3. The subject's primary anesthesia care team has planned for a neuraxial anesthetic (i.e. spinal, epidural or combined-spinal epidural)
4. The patient consents for an adductor canal block
5. Willing and able to sign an informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients unwilling or unable to consent to participate in the study.
2. Prisoners.
3. Pregnancy.
4. Reported to have mental illness or belonging to a vulnerable population.
5. Subject is < 18 years of age.
6. Patients receiving general anesthesia for the total knee arthroplasty.
7. Subject has impaired decision-making capacity per discretion of the Investigator.
8. Any condition for which the primary anesthesia care team deems neuraxial anesthesia inappropriate.
9. Significant pre-existing neuropathy on the operative limb.
10. Significant chronic pain disorders (i.e. fibromyalgia, complex regional pain syndrome I & II, among others).
11. Subject has sustained a significant trauma to the operative knee.
12. Chronic Opioid Use (daily or almost daily use of opioids for > 3 months).
13. Known hypersensitivity and/or allergies to local anesthetics.
14. Previous surgery on the affected knee excluding arthroscopic or open meniscectomy.
15. Patients with impaired renal function such that they cannot receive IV Toradol.
